Case reference: 2006013499.CaseDesc: Vital Vachon was last seen on May 1, 1973 when he departed a bush camp in Lucas Township, near Timmins, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006454.CaseDesc: Jonathan Jay Wood was last seen in November 2013, in Abbotsford, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014001524.CaseDesc: Matthew Leblanc was last seen by his sister on the morning of September 22, 1999, after he had coffee with her. Matthew was last observed at the bus stop located at the intersection of Superior/Menzies Street in Victoria. Matthew failed to attend an afternoon appointment and has not been heard or seen from since.

Case reference: 2014003128.CaseDesc: Olimpia Mikszan was last seen on the morning of June 21, 1996, outside her residence in Abbotsford, British Columbia.  She was living alone in a rental suite.  Her vehicle and nearly all of her personal belongings were left at her residence.  Olimpia had just completed high school.  Olimpia was born in Poland, speaks fluent Polish and has a slight Polish accent when speaking English.

Case reference: 2006022299.CaseDesc: Nick Kostiuk was last seen in a boat leaving a dock on Lower Manitou Lake. He could not swim and his wife saw him leaving without a life jacket. Mr. Kostiuk has been presumed drowned.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Accutron watch
Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wire frame

Case reference: 2019009625.CaseDesc: On August 12, 2018, Nikhil Arun was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004632.CaseDesc: On May 9th, 2005, Dean Phillips  was reported missing by his family in Campbell River, British Columbia. Dean was  last seen at a local school in Campbell River and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006019899.CaseDesc: Frank Uncapher was last seen on Lac Seul on October 21, 1974. He was on a hunting trip.

Case reference: 2012020006.CaseDesc: Lucas James Degerness was last seen on June 7, 2007 in Prince George, British-Columbia. He spent that night with a friend.

Mark: Torso (Back), Brown in color, left side
Head, Dime size bald spot - front

Case reference: 2007002599.CaseDesc: Mrs. Agnes May Appleyard was last seen standing in her yard, Lot # 2, Conc., # 4 McMurrich Township, Emsdale, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006008099.CaseDesc: Wilbert James Coulter's abandoned pick-up truck was located on December 28, 1990 on an old snowmobile trail in the Bancroft, Ontario area.  Search of the area failed to locate Mr. Coulter.

Case reference: 2012020099.CaseDesc: Jack (Mike) St. Pierre was last seen on July 17, 2009, at approximately 1:00 p.m. He was on foot southbound from "the point" toward the hamlet of Wollaston Lake. Mr. St. Pierre may have been seen later taking a boat across the Bay at Wollaston Lake. Articles of clothing were located in the water near where he was last thought to have been seen.

Case reference: 2006020699.CaseDesc: Frank Turtle was last seen on May 12, 1994 at South Camp on Peishk Lake, near Red Lake, Ontario. His boat was found but Mr. Turtle was never found.  He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014003894.CaseDesc: Jean Gravel and Jean-Guy Champagne were employees of the Rio Bar in downtown Trois-Rivières. On July 6, 1972, they arrived at work in the early evening; they were to work there until closing. They never returned home and have not been seen since. They were reported missing on July 10, 1972.

Jewelry: Gold, ring on the left ring finger
Silver, wedding ring on the left ring finger

Case reference: 2016043636.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1976, the body of a woman was discovered in a backyard in the Parkdale area of Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014006326.CaseDesc: Ronald Kay was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on November 26, 2013. He was last seen at the Saskatchewan Rough Riders Football game and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2021039166.CaseDesc: On January 9, 2003, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in the Marshy area, west of 19842 Yonge Street in East Gwillimbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016070209.CaseDesc: On April 11, 2003, the body of a woman was recovered from the bank of the North Saskatchewan River near the Riverdale area of Edmonton, Alberta.

Jewelry: Metal, Yellow, RING, With multiple clear stones and three yellow stones.
Metal, Yellow, RING, Has a clear stone
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, NECKLACE, Religious medallion of the Madonna

Case reference: 2017013508.CaseDesc: On March 26, 1989, the remains of a man were found in Fish Creek Park in Calgary, Alberta. The individual was missing four front teeth and may have worn a partial upper denture. Extensive dental work is present.

Case reference: 2017023444.CaseDesc: In July 1948, June Pauline Stevens was living in Cadillac, Saskatchewan when she disappeared and has not been heard from since. Ms. Stevens was thought to have travelled west to Port Alberni, BC to join her mother or to Winnipeg, MB to join other relatives.

Case reference: 2005152590.CaseDesc: Helen went for a walk and did not return. At the time of her disappearance, Helen had only been in Prince George for a few weeks.

Case reference: 2012020164.CaseDesc: These remains were located on the South West Marine Drive off-ramp below the north end of the Arthur Laing Bridge.

Case reference: 2014006380.CaseDesc: Dean Kelly Morrison was last seen October 23, 2013, after being dismissed from his job. His vehicle was left abandoned on a ranch.

Case reference: 2013000112.CaseDesc: On March 14, 2012, a male was found in a densely wooded area to the north east of the junction of Winchester Road and Ritson Road, in Oshawa, Ontario. His appendix was present. It is believed he had been there from a few days to a few weeks.

Hair: Brown, Short, Shorter than collar length; few days growth of facial hair
Teeth: He had a full set of adult teeth with no restorations

Case reference: 2020051250.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1983, an unidentified woman died. Shortly before her death, she was observed in the Montreal, Quebec area.

Case reference: 2018070577.CaseDesc: On January 15, 2018, at approximately 6:00pm, Albert Ramponi was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003304.CaseDesc: Milde was last seen in 1993 where his vehicle was abandoned near the City of Lethbridge Landfill. Footprints in the snow were seen leading from the vehicle into the coulees and disappeared.

Case reference: 2014005541.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2010, Shawn Smith was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. On September 6, Shawn arrived in the Dominican Republic and was scheduled to return on the September 12, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2008009698.CaseDesc: Richard Rusholme was last seen when he left his residence.  He was preparing to leave with a friend to look for work out West and had already packed his bags. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012003299.CaseDesc: David Wardle lived alone in Wilberforce, Ontario. He worked off and on at a local mill and kept mostly to himself. During the fall of 1981, Mr. Wardle advised a family member that he had gotten into some trouble and would be leaving for awhile to get it straightened out. Approximately one week later Mr. Wardle and his truck were missing from his home. Family members are concerned for his well-being as his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014005315.CaseDesc: Darryl Dubitski was last seen by his family leaving his residence in Edmonton, Alberta in December of 1982. Darryl had informed his family that he was travelling to the United States.

Case reference: 2019050902.CaseDesc: On January 28, 2017, the body of an elderly man was found outside the Westside Church in downtown Vancouver, where he had been sleeping. He was very thin and he had an L-shaped scar on the right side of his lower back.

Case reference: 2018054180.CaseDesc: On May 8, 1992, John Leonard was seen for the last time when he borrowed a friend's vehicle.  Later that same day, the vehicle was recovered at Woodbine Racetrack in Toronto.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Pair of dice

Case reference: 2014001445.CaseDesc: On July 13, 1992, Howard Scott was last seen in Calgary, Alberta. Howard was travelling in his red 1985 Ford LTD Station Wagon from Calgary and was destined to return to Richmond, British Columbia. On August 15, 1992, Howard’s abandoned vehicle was located in a heavily wooded logging road near Moyie, British Columbia.  Howard has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003950.CaseDesc: Lyndon Fuller was last seen on November 25, 1988, in the area of the local hospital in Berwick, Nova Scotia. Lyndon had jumped from a third floor window following his admission to the hospital. Lyndon left on foot in an unknown direction.

Case reference: 2019053661.CaseDesc:
On July 2, 1988, an unidentified man was found in the parking lot of the Value Village
on East Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had suffered from a
heart attack, and the results of his autopsy showed evidence of previous heart damage and a case of mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012003199.CaseDesc: In 1982, Lance Kunderman, age 22, left his home in Waterloo Region and headed to Banff, Alberta. Lance was reportedly in British Columbia in October 1982 and was to travel abroad. He was working with singer Eric Clapton's road crew. On December 26, 1982 Lance spoke with his family saying he was still with the band. Information was that Lance worked between Los Angeles and Vancouver. He was last seen in Vancouver, British Columbia in October 1982.

Scar: Genitals, may have a surgical scar from a twisted testicle operation

Case reference: 2014002407.CaseDesc: Robert Scott Ellis and a friend headed out fishing on June 27, 1973. They left in the morning around 9:30 am and fished until around 6:00 pm when they decided to return home. During the course of the day, poor weather rolled in and the water became quite rough. They started taking in water over the sides of the canoe. Despite the progress they made, one wave eventually rolled the canoe. Both men hung onto the canoe for hours, but Robert eventually tired and let go.  When the friend eventually reached shore, he reported the incident. Dragging and diving operations were initiated and the results were negative. Mr. Ellis is presumed to have drowned. No foul play is suspected in this case.

Case reference: 2005003599.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2002, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River near the Maid of the Mist dock in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem length was 5’5" and his weight was 114lbs., however, due to the condition of the body, this is an underestimate and he weighed more in life. It is estimated that he was in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: Has an amalgam filling on his left lower first molar and poor dental hygiene

Case reference: 2014003425.CaseDesc: Christopher Giberson, went missing from the Saint John Regional Hospital on Friday, January 28th, 2000, at 7:00 p.m. where he was taken for treatment and then assessment, but he walked away before being seen by staff.

Case reference: 2014003777.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1988, François Piquet was seen for the last time when he left the family residence located in the Saint-Laurent district of Montreal, Quebec. François left his ID cards behind and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014006426.CaseDesc: Sara Coates was last seen in the Stanley Park area in Calgary, Alberta. Ms. Coates was leading a nomadic lifestyle, living out of her van with her dog and 3 cats, travelling around Alberta and BC. Ms. Coates’ van was located October 22, 2013, in a secluded area of Morley, Alberta. It appeared to have been there for some time. Police investigations regarding Ms. Coates’ whereabouts are ongoing.

Scar: 2 small surgical scars on inner groin

Case reference: 2018034585.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2004, at approximately 8:00 am, Stephen Lawrence was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Stephen had said he would be home in a few hours.

Shirt: Blue, Brand: Calvin Klein; long sleeves

Case reference: 2014004451.CaseDesc: On February 22, 1964, Marie Mike was seen for the last time leaving a residence on the Beardy's/Okemasis First Nation Reserve near Rosthern, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014002539.CaseDesc: On August 28, 1973, Amelie McArthur’s vehicle was found running with the lights on and the driver’s side door open on the Taylor Bridge in Taylor, BC. Amelie was last seen leaving her home in Taylor in that vehicle earlier that morning.

Case reference: 2014003107.CaseDesc: Jean Fournier was last seen in Montreal on August 30, 1993. He was very stressed and depressed. He left a letter for his wife stating that he was leaving all of his belongings to her. He left his house with little money in his pocket.

Sweater: Cotton, Cream, Ivory, Black, black stripes

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2014005582.CaseDesc: Lionel Joseph Daigle went missing from the New Direction Special Care home, located on the Westside of the City of Saint John. Mr. Daigle was last seen April 3, 2011. He is reported to have mental health issues and requires regular medication. The public is urged to contact the Saint John Police Force with any information concerning his whereabouts.

Jacket: Grey, Winter jacket, 3/4 length with hood

Case reference: 2014001077.CaseDesc: On February 27, 1974, the remains of a small, middle aged Indigenous man were found collapsed on Alexander Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had no natural teeth and had a star-like scar on his left wrist.

Case reference: 2016062636.CaseDesc:
On November 6, 2016, Maxwell Harvey Mayling was reported missing from Prince George, British Columbia.  Mr. Mayling was last heard from in early October, 2016 by friends and family.  Mr. Mayling is known to frequent both the Prince George and Fort St John municipalities, and was last known to have been in Prince George since July 2016.

Mr. Mayling's maroon 1995 Ford Taurus was located in late November, 2016 in Prince George, however all other efforts to locate Mr. Mayling have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2020019009.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2020, Sameer Patel was seen for the last time by his friends when he accidentally fell into the Niagara River located in Ontario, while hiking.

Case reference: 2014005209.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1990, at approximately 10:15am, Cindy Clair was seen for the last time near 25 Martha Eaton Way in Toronto, Ontario. Ms. Clair told her roommate she was going for a walk and never returned.

Case reference: 2021048123.CaseDesc: On September 16, 2021, an unidentified man was discovered near 35 Carl Hall road in Toronto, Ontario.

Purse: Black, Black pouch with white edging, zippered, and on a clip
Pants: Denim, Black, Blue, Brand: Guess, jeans
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Small Toe, 5th toe on the left foot
Left Chest, Healed fracture on the left side ribs 10,11 and 12
Right Chest, Healed fracture of right ribs 11 and 12

Case reference: 2014003363.CaseDesc: At 2:00 a.m. on April 21st, 1992, Hilda BEAUDOIN and her brother left the Beagle Lounge in Mary's Harbour, NL on a single snowmobile to ride across the sea ice near coastal waters in efforts to return to St. Lewis, NL. They did not arrive at their destination. Snowmobile tracks were discovered leading into open water near St. Lewis where the snowmobile and her brother's body were later recovered from the ocean waters.

Case reference: 2014005363.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1986, Edward Beauchamp failed to meet with his probation officer for a scheduled appointment in Edmonton, Alberta. Edward has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, "Born To Be Wild"
Left Forearm, "Born to Raise Hell 1952 Eddie"
Right Hand, "Love" on backs of fingers
Left Hand, Club, diamond, spade and heart on knuckles
Left Hand, "Hate" on backs of fingers
Right Forearm, Cobra and tumbleweed chief
Right Upper Arm , "Born to be free"

Case reference: 2014002145.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1975, Mr. Garson with his father, brother and a friend set out for Moose Lake to hunt. On September 14, other hunters found gas cans, and a thermos with the name of Garson on it. These hunters reported their findings to police.  A search was initiated and police found a boat submerged upright on the bottom of the lake. The depth of the lake around the boat was only 8 to 10 feet deep. It appeared to Police that the men encountered extremely rough water while crossing Moose Lake. The motors were both found to be in forward gear. There was no floatation gear in the boat and it was heavily loaded with camping and hunting equipment. All of the bodies were recovered with the exception of M. Garson. It is presumed Mr. Garson drowned.

Case reference: 2013000036.CaseDesc: Pierre Roy was last seen on January 28, 1983.  He was involved in an altercation in a bar in Montreal and has not been seen since.

Teeth: Braces, Wears 2 dentures, the top one is welded
Scar: Right Leg, 2 scars on each side of 5" long

Case reference: 2006017899.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1973, John Begolo was last seen in Eganville, Ontario.  John indicated that he was planning to return to St. Catherine's, Ontario, by bus.  John has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Canadian Flag and Maple Leaf
Left Forearm, Nude woman entwined by snake

Case reference: 2018005318.CaseDesc: In November 2016 Fereydoun Taleshpour Bandari left his apartment in the Carlton Street and Church Street area of Toronto, to travel.  It is believed Mr. Taleshpour Bandari was sick at the time he left his home.  All of his belongings were left in the apartment and his family cannot account for his whereabouts.

Hair: Black, Short, Straight, Black moustache and beard

Case reference: 2014006256.CaseDesc: Christopher Maier resides in Saskatoon and came to Regina to visit family and friends in December 1994. It was assumed that Mr. Maier went back to Saskatoon, however, this information was not confirmed. Mr. Maier has not been seen since and was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on September 18, 2013.

Scar: Forehead, The scar was L shaped. No actual size of the scar is available.
Pierce: Ears, He had one piercing in his right ear.

Case reference: 2012020160.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from Cypress Mountain, West Vancouver. He was fully clothed, inside a sleeping bag.

Teeth: Protruding Lowers, Distinctive under bite, 2 porcelain crowns on bottom front teeth which were noticeably more white
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Gold, "Seiko" brand

Case reference: 2014003919.CaseDesc: On September 19, 2000, Ronald Montgomery went missing from his home in Calgary. He has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2021057203.CaseDesc: Liam Askin was reported missing by family on December 10, 2021. He was last seen at the east Banff Park gates on November 15, 2020. Liam has significant mental and physical illnesses. There have been no confirmed footprints of life since.

Case reference: 2012020140.CaseDesc: Melina Martin of Sainte-Sabine was last seen on January 23, 2005 at 1:30 pm in the Bourbonnais park in Farnham.

Case reference: 2013000117.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1960, police received a report of a lost child in the Red Lake area, 72 km Northwest of Kamloops. 21-month-old Edna Bette-Jean Masters known to the family as Bette-Jean, was last seen playing with family and friends at a friend's residence.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, Oval shape burn scar
Deformity: Ears, Slight bent ear lobe, unknown which ear

Case reference: 2018064370.CaseDesc: On November 8, 2018, at approximately 8:30 am, Artur Mis was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Artur did not show up for work on November 9 and 12th, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014006224.CaseDesc: In January 2013, Da Wang was seen for the last time by his fiancé in Buffalo, New York. However, the two continued to communicate through text messages for several months. On July 11, 2013, at approximately 7:18 p.m., Da’s fiancé received a final text message from him indicating that he was in trouble.

Case reference: 2014001469.CaseDesc: On November 28,1988, Douglas Babineau was seen for the last time at a party located on First Avenue in Moncton, New Brunswick. Douglas has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2010005899.CaseDesc: Mark Edmonson disappeared from his residence in Stoney Creek on October 3, 1999. Mr. Edmonson has not returned or contacted his family members since that time and both his family and Police are concerned for his well being. Mr. Edmonson is developmentally challenged. It is believed that Mr. Edmonson left home without taking any money or personal identification. Extensive police searches have failed to determine his whereabouts.

Pants: Blue, Jeans with hole in left knee

Case reference: 2014003491.CaseDesc: On June 12th, 1981, Gordon Westover was seen at a local beer garden in Fort St John, BC at approximately 11:00 PM. Mr. Westover left the gathering in an unknown direction and has not been seen or heard from since. Mr. Westover has a mild mental disability and has been known to impersonate professional people such as police, firefighters, military and doctors. Mr. Westover told several people at the party that he was going to join the military, but no records show Mr. Westover was ever recruited. Mr. Westover has not been seen or heard from.

Case reference: 2006020599.CaseDesc: Simon Angeconeb was last seen on July 10, 1993 at Cat Island Lodge located on Red Lake in the District of Kenora, Ontario. He was heading to his cabin to go to sleep and has not been seen since. Mr. Angeconeb may have been suffering from a concussion.

Case reference: 2012020046.CaseDesc: On January, 17, 2008, Bradley Worobeck left his place of employment in downtown Calgary and went to a pub that was also in downtown Calgary. That was the last time anyone saw or heard from Bradley.

Case reference: 2019052112.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1974, the body of an elderly man was found in a parking lot on East Hastings St in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had grey hair and a moustache and was believed to be living a transient lifestyle. He died of heart disease.

Case reference: 2013000044.CaseDesc: Carole Roy, who also went by several aliases, was last seen in 1996 near Carlton Place, Ontario. Ms. Roy has lived in Carlton Place, Ottawa, and various places in Quebec. She was reported missing by her family.

Case reference: 2019043440.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2019, Victor Cuthand was reported missing from the City of Brockville, Ontario. Victor’s last known whereabouts were at a shelter located in downtown Toronto, Ontario, as of March, 2020. This was also the last time that Victor had communicated with his family.

Case reference: 2014004386.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2003, Adolph Sewap was last seen in Sturgeon Landing near Creighton, Saskatchewan. Adolph had some medical issues and was known to travel to other communities.

Other: Walks bent forward with hands behind his back

Case reference: 2017013576.CaseDesc: Hellen Ermias and her daughter Lina Tedros entered Canada seeking asylum.  They were provided a temporary apartment but disappeared shortly after with no explanation and without their belongings.

Case reference: 2006008199.CaseDesc: Harley Metherel telephoned home from Vancouver on December 24, 1980, requesting a money transfer. Money was sent to him, but he never picked it up, and he has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2018063453.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2003, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Senotta Thomas was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. Senotta had left her home to go to work, but did not return home.

Case reference: 2022029698.CaseDesc: On December 22, 1988, Stanley Benoanie was seen for the last time in Stoney Rapids, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2012020109.CaseDesc: David Fortin was last seen while waiting for the school bus on the morning of February 10, 2009, in Alma, Quebec. He was to take the school bus at approximately 7:50 am to get to the Camille Lavoie High School in Alma. However, he never got onto the bus and did not report to school. According to his family, David was a victim of bullying and intimidation at school for several years.

Case reference: 2014005172.CaseDesc: Debra Marlow was last seen in Kingston Ontario on November 3rd, 2008, where she had a mental health assessment at Kingston General Hospital. She was despondent at that time, and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2019045788.CaseDesc: On March 11, 2019, the remains of an adult male were found in a forested area in North Burnaby. He is estimated to have gone missing around March 2013, and may have been despondent at the time.

Socks: White, Black, Black on toe area and heal
Sweater: Synthetic, Light Green, Hoodie, Fleece, "Athletic" on the front, size M, Giordano brand
Belt: Leather, Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Metal steel clasp

Case reference: 2021003909.CaseDesc: On April 6, 2018, Rita Squalli and Maria Squalli were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Rita and Maria were taken by their father under false pretences, and it is believed that the girls are being kept overseas.

Case reference: 2014006562.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2014, Kamalanathan Kandasamy was seen for the last time in Markham, Ontario. His backpack, which contained all of his personal effects and his identification, was found near the Horseshoe Falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016068328.CaseDesc: This male foot was found washed up on the shore of Gull Island in Presqu'ile Provincial Park. The foot was inside a black "PUMA" ankle sock and a size 11 women's "Mizuno Wave Prophecy" running shoe. The shoe was first available for sale in Spring 2011. The post-mortem interval is anywhere from one month to 2 and a half years.

Case reference: 2014002843.CaseDesc: A party of 6 men departed Churchill, Manitoba, on a fishing trip traveling in three canoes. On June 20, 1967, two of the three canoes became stranded on mud flats at a point where the Hayes and Nelson Rivers empty into the Hudson Bay. The men made camp for the night and then the following day Kurt Hild, Ronald Davidson and James Cochrane all attempted to retrieve the stranded canoes. On return to the camp the men were confronted with high winds and freezing rain which forced them out of sight. None of the remains of the men have been recovered. Foul play is not suspected in the matter.

Case reference: 2016026672.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1978, a Caucasian male was found in the woods bounded by Hwy 169, the CN Railway tracks and the Black River (Lot 26/27 Concession L, Rama Township) in Washago, Ontario. He had stains on his teeth which suggest he was a smoker. He is believed to have been dead for 1-5 years.

Teeth: His teeth were well cared for and had extensive conservative dental restorations.

Case reference: 2014005152.CaseDesc: Anker Ljunggren was a farm hand who worked in Yellow Grass, SK. Ljunggren was last seen in October, 1935, by his wife. He was working in Craik or Craven, SK but was heading north to find more work and was never seen or heard from again.

Case reference: 2019073876.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2019, Anton Katona was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2018063232.CaseDesc: On December 31, 1999, Elizabeth Shelly was last seen as she left the shelter she was staying at in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001116.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1992, the skeletal remains of a man were found near Parksville on the Englishman River in British Colombia. The man had extensive dental restorations and may have been American. He recently had surgery for ingrown toenails, on both feet, and had a healed fracture to the left collarbone, which was repaired with a surgical wire. It is estimated that he may have died several months earlier.

Shirt: Other, T-Shirt, Brand Royal Comfort, size 42-44
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Wristwatch, Casio
Shoes: White, Grey, Runners, Brand Brooks, blue striped
Fractured/Broken Bones: Chest, Healed rib and clavicle fracture
Foreign Object: Chest, Stainless steel wire in the left clavicle

Case reference: 2010002599.CaseDesc: On the morning of Monday, July 19, 2010, Curtis Barry left his residence on Britannia Avenue in Bradford, to walk his two dogs. He was reported missing when his wife returned home in the late afternoon and discovered he was not home. The dogs were located later the same day wandering the streets approximately 1 km from his residence. Mr. Barry has not been seen since and the dog leash has not been located.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, a ship and names Lauren, John and Cliff on boat
Torso (Back), 3 roses with names of Michelle, Kietan and Kayla

Case reference: 2014003643.CaseDesc: Dean Mortensen was reported missing on January 24, 1992, after he failed to attend his classes at the University of Alberta in Edmonton, Alberta. Dean was last seen by his friends leaving the on campus bar, The Ship. They parted ways with him within 200 metres of his dorm room at the St. Joseph's College that night.

Jacket: Grande Cache Bantam Elks leather hockey jacket with gold shoulders, white collar, "Dean" on sleeve
Shirt: ST JOSEPH, St. Joseph crest on front

Case reference: 2005005199.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1988, an unidentified man was discovered in a creek near Cushman Road in St. Catharines, Ontario. A black plastic comb was found in his pocket, as well as a Salvation Army registration card with the name ‘Roscoe Echo (21JUNE1923, Place of Birth: New York City).

Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Timex, silver band
Shirt: White, Button up with red stripes

Case reference: 2017070923.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2017, Yoseph Birhanu-Baynesagn left his home sometime in the middle of the night. The next day, Yoseph called his cousin from a payphone at Union Station stating he was coming for a visit. He never made it to his cousin's and has not been heard from since.
